alert.note: Alert for Marion; Washington (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 25 at 3:49PM EDT until July 25 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Louisville has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Marion County in central Kentucky... Southeastern Washington County in central Kentucky... * Until 445 PM EDT. * At 349 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lebanon, Springfield, Bradfordsville, Penick, Poplar Corner, Simstown, Calvary, Rineltown, Greenbriar and Jimtown. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
